page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: {The Pembury Area and the Area to the {South.} The area covered is primarily agricultural. The major land use category is pasture, on which cattle graze. There are large tracts of woodland to the east, near Kipping's Cross, much of which is at present being felled. The area is encircled by roads, only small lanes reach into the farmland. This central area rises to 132 metres and is crossed by small streams. To the west lies the outskirts of Tunbridge Wells, an attractive area, partly residential, with two schools,, and very pleasant parkland. It is known as Sandown Park. To the north lies the village of Pembury. This is the most populated area of the 12 square kilometres.
